title: Man drowns at Urunga beach while trying to save son
text:
A man has drowned trying to rescue his 14-year-old son from a rip at an unpatrolled beach on the NSW Mid North Coast.

A man has drowned at Urunga Beach on the NSW mid-north coast (NBN News)

A man has drowned trying to rescue his son from a rip at an unpatrolled beach on the NSW mid-north coast.

The 14-year-old boy got into trouble while swimming at a beach in Urunga around 11.30am this morning.

His 53-year-old father from Wollongong swam out to rescue him, but became stranded and drowned, Nine News reports.

The teen was pulled from the water and treated for exhaustion and shock, and taken to Coffs Harbour Base Hospital.

“As we become more active in and around water during the summer months, it is imperative that everyone remains vigilant in and around the water,” NSW Ambulance duty operations manager Brendon Dean said in a statement. “Accidents can happen in seconds but the impact remains for a lifetime.”

Local MP Melinda Pavey and her 17-year-old daughter Emily were on patrol at the time. Emily went with another patrol member to offer support for the boy, The Daily Telegraph reported.

“Our patrol captain and our other IRB patrol member who found the father 600 metres out to sea were clearly impacted when they returned to our patrol,” Mrs Pavey said.

“Everyone’s training worked really well. No one panicked. It is disbelief. That’s what we train for but it’s unbelievable when an emergency happens.”

The incident follows the drowning of a 45-year-old northern Sydney man at the NSW south coast’s Manyana Beach on Thursday afternoon.
description: A man has drowned trying to rescue his son from a rip at an unpatrolled beach on the NSW mid-north coast.
